name: Bennett v. Rittenhouse Short-Term Building & Loan Association, Appellant
name_abbreviation: Bennett v. Rittenhouse Short-Term Building & Loan Ass'n

judges: Before Frazer, C. J., Simpson, Kephart, Schaeeer, Maxey, Drew and Linn, JJ.
parties: Bennett v. Rittenhouse Short-Term Building & Loan Association, Appellant.

opinions.text:
Pee Cubiam,
The opinion of the learned judge of the court below fully and correctly disposes of all questions raised in this appeal. The judgment is accordingly affirmed on his opinion.
opinions.author: Pee Cubiam,

attorneys: Louis A. J. Robbins, for appellant.
Abraham L. Hodes and Harry PoUsh, of PoUsh & Wachs, for appellee, were not heard.
casebody.head_matter:
Bennett v. Rittenhouse Short-Term Building & Loan Association, Appellant.
Argued December 7, 1933.
Before Frazer, C. J., Simpson, Kephart, Schaeeer, Maxey, Drew and Linn, JJ.
January 2, 1934:
Louis A. J. Robbins, for appellant.
Abraham L. Hodes and Harry PoUsh, of PoUsh & Wachs, for appellee, were not heard.
